name: Video Client Processing
description: Sector template for client-side video processing patents including ABR clients, video players, buffer management, and quality of experience optimization.
contextDescription: Video client processing patents cover the player and client-side technologies for streaming video consumption. Key areas include ABR algorithms, buffer management, bitrate selection, quality of experience (QoE) metrics, seamless playback, and multi-device support. Targets include streaming app developers, smart TV manufacturers, set-top box makers, and mobile device OEMs.
scoringGuidance: ABR algorithm patents that improve bitrate selection under varying network conditions are high value.
Buffer management innovations that reduce rebuffering while minimizing latency are critical for live streaming.
QoE-based patents that correlate technical metrics with user satisfaction have broad applicability.
Multi-device/multi-screen patents are valuable as viewing shifts between devices.
Low-latency streaming client patents (sub-second latency) are emerging high-value area for live sports/events.

questions.question: Does this patent address adaptive bitrate selection algorithms? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic throughput-based ABR, 7-10 for advanced (buffer-based, hybrid, ML-based, low-latency).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the ABR approach: throughput estimation, buffer occupancy, hybrid, or machine learning based.

questions.question: Does this patent optimize video buffering or playback continuity? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic buffering, 7-10 for advanced (predictive, adaptive, low-latency optimized).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess buffer strategy sophistication and impact on rebuffering/startup delay.

questions.question: Does this patent measure or optimize quality of experience (QoE)? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic quality metrics, 7-10 for comprehensive QoE (perceptual quality, engagement correlation).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify QoE metrics: VMAF, MOS, rebuffering ratio, startup time, bitrate stability.

questions.question: What player architecture components does this patent address? Consider: media pipeline, decoder integration, DRM client, UI/controls, analytics.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify player components and assess architectural breadth vs. specific optimization.

questions.question: What device types does this patent target? Score 1-3 for single device type, 4-6 for multiple (TV + mobile), 7-10 for universal/cross-platform or emerging devices (VR/AR).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess device applicability: smart TV, mobile, STB, gaming console, web, VR/AR.
